verses.verse: Thou shalt not <S%H3808><s%> see <S%H7200><s%> <S%H853><s%> thy brother's <S%H251><s%> ox <S%H7794><s%> or <S%H176><s%> <S%H853><s%> his sheep <S%H7716><s%> go astray, <S%H5080><s%> and hide thyself <S%H5956><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> them: thou shalt in any case bring them again <S%H7725><s%> <S%H7725><s%> unto thy brother. <S%H251><s%>

And if <S%H518><s%> thy brother <S%H251><s%> be not <S%H3808><s%> nigh <S%H7138><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> thee, or if thou know <S%H3045><s%> him not, <S%H3808><s%> then thou shalt bring <S%H622><s%> it unto <S%H413><s%> <S%H8432><s%> thine own house, <S%H1004><s%> and it shall be <S%H1961><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> thee until <S%H5704><s%> thy brother <S%H251><s%> seek after <S%H1875><s%> it, and thou shalt restore <S%H7725><s%> it to him again.

In like manner <S%H3651><s%> shalt thou do <S%H6213><s%> with his ass; <S%H2543><s%> and so <S%H3651><s%> shalt thou do <S%H6213><s%> with his raiment; <S%H8071><s%> and with all <S%H3605><s%> lost thing <S%H9><s%> of thy brother's, <S%H251><s%> which <S%H834><s%> he hath lost, <S%H6><s%> and thou hast found, <S%H4672><s%> shalt thou do <S%H6213><s%> likewise: <S%H3651><s%> thou mayest <S%H3201><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> hide thyself. <S%H5956><s%>

Thou shalt not <S%H3808><s%> see <S%H7200><s%> <S%H853><s%> thy brother's <S%H251><s%> ass <S%H2543><s%> or <S%H176><s%> his ox <S%H7794><s%> fall down <S%H5307><s%> by the way, <S%H1870><s%> and hide thyself <S%H5956><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> them: thou shalt surely help him to lift them up again. <S%H6965><s%> <S%H6965><s%> <S%H5973><s%>

The woman <S%H802><s%> shall not <S%H3808><s%> wear <S%H1961><s%> that which pertaineth <S%H3627><s%> unto a man, <S%H1397><s%> neither <S%H3808><s%> shall a man <S%H1397><s%> put on <S%H3847><s%> a woman's <S%H802><s%> garment: <S%H8071><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> that do <S%H6213><s%> so <S%H428><s%> are abomination <S%H8441><s%> unto the LORD <S%H3068><s%> thy God. <S%H430><s%>

If <S%H3588><s%> a bird's <S%H6833><s%> nest <S%H7064><s%> chance to be <S%H7122><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> thee in the way <S%H1870><s%> in any <S%H3605><s%> tree, <S%H6086><s%> or <S%H176><s%> on <S%H5921><s%> the ground, <S%H776><s%> whether they be young ones, <S%H667><s%> or <S%H176><s%> eggs, <S%H1000><s%> and the dam <S%H517><s%> sitting <S%H7257><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> the young, <S%H667><s%> or <S%H176><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> the eggs, <S%H1000><s%> thou shalt not <S%H3808><s%> take <S%H3947><s%> the dam <S%H517><s%> with <S%H5921><s%> the young: <S%H1121><s%>

But thou shalt in any wise <S%H7971><s%> <S%H853><s%> let the dam <S%H517><s%> go, <S%H7971><s%> and take <S%H3947><s%> the young <S%H1121><s%> to thee; that <S%H4616><s%> it may be well <S%H3190><s%> with thee, and that thou mayest prolong <S%H748><s%> thy days. <S%H3117><s%>

When <S%H3588><s%> thou buildest <S%H1129><s%> a new <S%H2319><s%> house, <S%H1004><s%> then thou shalt make <S%H6213><s%> a battlement <S%H4624><s%> for thy roof, <S%H1406><s%> that thou bring <S%H7760><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> blood <S%H1818><s%> upon thine house, <S%H1004><s%> if <S%H3588><s%> any man <S%H5307><s%> fall <S%H5307><s%> from <S%H4480><s%> thence.

Thou shalt not <S%H3808><s%> sow <S%H2232><s%> thy vineyard <S%H3754><s%> with divers seeds: <S%H3610><s%> lest <S%H6435><s%> the fruit <S%H4395><s%> of thy seed <S%H2233><s%> which <S%H834><s%> thou hast sown, <S%H2232><s%> and the fruit <S%H8393><s%> of thy vineyard, <S%H3754><s%> be defiled. <S%H6942><s%>
Thou shalt not <S%H3808><s%> plow <S%H2790><s%> with an ox <S%H7794><s%> and an ass <S%H2543><s%> together. <S%H3162><s%>
Thou shalt not <S%H3808><s%> wear <S%H3847><s%> a garment of divers sorts, <S%H8162><s%> as of woolen <S%H6785><s%> and linen <S%H6593><s%> together. <S%H3162><s%>

Thou shalt make <S%H6213><s%> thee fringes <S%H1434><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> the four <S%H702><s%> quarters <S%H3671><s%> of thy vesture, <S%H3682><s%> wherewith <S%H834><s%> thou coverest <S%H3680><s%> thyself.
If <S%H3588><s%> any man <S%H376><s%> take <S%H3947><s%> a wife, <S%H802><s%> and go in <S%H935><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> her, and hate <S%H8130><s%> her,

And give <S%H7760><s%> occasions <S%H5949><s%> of speech <S%H1697><s%> against her, and bring up <S%H3318><s%> an evil <S%H7451><s%> name <S%H8034><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> her, and say, <S%H559><s%> I took <S%H3947><s%> <S%H853><s%> this <S%H2063><s%> woman, <S%H802><s%> and when I came <S%H7126><s%> to <S%H413><s%> her, I found <S%H4672><s%> her not <S%H3808><s%> a maid: <S%H1331><s%>

Then shall the father <S%H1><s%> of the damsel, <S%H5291><s%> and her mother, <S%H517><s%> take <S%H3947><s%> and bring forth <S%H3318><s%> <S%H853><s%> the tokens of the damsel's <S%H5291><s%> virginity <S%H1331><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> the elders <S%H2205><s%> of the city <S%H5892><s%> in the gate: <S%H8179><s%>

And the damsel's <S%H5291><s%> father <S%H1><s%> shall say <S%H559><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> the elders, <S%H2205><s%> I gave <S%H5414><s%> <S%H853><s%> my daughter <S%H1323><s%> unto this <S%H2088><s%> man <S%H376><s%> to wife, <S%H802><s%> and he hateth <S%H8130><s%> her;

And, lo, <S%H2009><s%> he <S%H1931><s%> hath given <S%H7760><s%> occasions <S%H5949><s%> of speech <S%H1697><s%> against her, saying, <S%H559><s%> I found <S%H4672><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> thy daughter <S%H1323><s%> a maid; <S%H1331><s%> and yet these <S%H428><s%> are the tokens of my daughter's <S%H1323><s%> virginity. <S%H1331><s%> And they shall spread <S%H6566><s%> the cloth <S%H8071><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the elders <S%H2205><s%> of the city. <S%H5892><s%>
And the elders <S%H2205><s%> of that <S%H1931><s%> city <S%H5892><s%> shall take <S%H3947><s%> <S%H853><s%> that man <S%H376><s%> and chastise <S%H3256><s%> him;

And they shall amerce <S%H6064><s%> him in a hundred <S%H3967><s%> shekels of silver, <S%H3701><s%> and give <S%H5414><s%> them unto the father <S%H1><s%> of the damsel, <S%H5291><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> he hath brought up <S%H3318><s%> an evil <S%H7451><s%> name <S%H8034><s%> upon <S%H5921><s%> a virgin <S%H1330><s%> of Israel: <S%H3478><s%> and she shall be <S%H1961><s%> his wife; <S%H802><s%> he may <S%H3201><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> put her away <S%H7971><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> his days. <S%H3117><s%>

But if <S%H518><s%> this <S%H2088><s%> thing <S%H1697><s%> be <S%H1961><s%> true, <S%H571><s%> and the tokens of virginity <S%H1331><s%> be not <S%H3808><s%> found <S%H4672><s%> for the damsel: <S%H5291><s%>

Then they shall bring out <S%H3318><s%> <S%H853><s%> the damsel <S%H5291><s%> to <S%H413><s%> the door <S%H6607><s%> of her father's <S%H1><s%> house, <S%H1004><s%> and the men <S%H376><s%> of her city <S%H5892><s%> shall stone <S%H5619><s%> her with stones <S%H68><s%> that she die: <S%H4191><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> she hath wrought <S%H6213><s%> folly <S%H5039><s%> in Israel, <S%H3478><s%> to play the whore <S%H2181><s%> in her father's <S%H1><s%> house: <S%H1004><s%> so shalt thou put evil away <S%H1197><s%> <S%H7451><s%> from among <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7130><s%> you.

If <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> be found <S%H4672><s%> lying <S%H7901><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> a woman <S%H802><s%> married <S%H1166><s%> to a husband, <S%H1167><s%> then they shall both <S%H1571><s%> <S%H8147><s%> of them die, <S%H4191><s%> both the man <S%H376><s%> that lay <S%H7901><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> the woman, <S%H802><s%> and the woman: <S%H802><s%> so shalt thou put away <S%H1197><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> from Israel. <S%H4480><s%> <S%H3478><s%>

If <S%H3588><s%> a damsel <S%H5291><s%> that is a virgin <S%H1330><s%> be <S%H1961><s%> betrothed <S%H781><s%> unto a husband, <S%H376><s%> and a man <S%H376><s%> find <S%H4672><s%> her in the city, <S%H5892><s%> and lie <S%H7901><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> her;

Then ye shall bring them both out <S%H3318><s%> <S%H853><s%> <S%H8147><s%> unto <S%H413><s%> the gate <S%H8179><s%> of that <S%H1931><s%> city, <S%H5892><s%> and ye shall stone <S%H5619><s%> them with stones <S%H68><s%> that they die; <S%H4191><s%> <S%H853><s%> the damsel, <S%H5291><s%> because <S%H5921><s%> <S%H1697><s%> <S%H834><s%> she cried <S%H6817><s%> not, <S%H3808><s%> being in the city; <S%H5892><s%> and the man, <S%H376><s%> because <S%H5921><s%> <S%H1697><s%> <S%H834><s%> he hath humbled <S%H6031><s%> <S%H853><s%> his neighbor's <S%H7453><s%> wife: <S%H802><s%> so thou shalt put away <S%H1197><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%> from among <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7130><s%> you.

But if <S%H518><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> find <S%H4672><s%> <S%H853><s%> a betrothed <S%H781><s%> damsel <S%H5291><s%> in the field, <S%H7704><s%> and the man <S%H376><s%> force <S%H2388><s%> her, and lie <S%H7901><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> her: then the man <S%H376><s%> only <S%H905><s%> that <S%H834><s%> lay <S%H7901><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> her shall die: <S%H4191><s%>

But unto the damsel <S%H5291><s%> thou shalt do <S%H6213><s%> nothing; <S%H3808><s%> <S%H1697><s%> there is in the damsel <S%H5291><s%> no <S%H369><s%> sin <S%H2399><s%> worthy of death: <S%H4194><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> as <S%H834><s%> when a man <S%H376><s%> riseth <S%H6965><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> his neighbor, <S%H7453><s%> and slayeth <S%H7523><s%> <S%H5315><s%> him, even so <S%H3651><s%> is this <S%H2088><s%> matter: <S%H1697><s%>

For <S%H3588><s%> he found <S%H4672><s%> her in the field, <S%H7704><s%> and the betrothed <S%H781><s%> damsel <S%H5291><s%> cried, <S%H6817><s%> and there was none <S%H369><s%> to save <S%H3467><s%> her.

If <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> find <S%H4672><s%> a damsel <S%H5291><s%> that is a virgin, <S%H1330><s%> which <S%H834><s%> is not <S%H3808><s%> betrothed, <S%H781><s%> and lay hold <S%H8610><s%> on her, and lie <S%H7901><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> her, and they be found; <S%H4672><s%>

Then the man <S%H376><s%> that lay <S%H7901><s%> with <S%H5973><s%> her shall give <S%H5414><s%> unto the damsel's <S%H5291><s%> father <S%H1><s%> fifty <S%H2572><s%> shekels of silver, <S%H3701><s%> and she shall be <S%H1961><s%> his wife; <S%H802><s%> because <S%H8478><s%> <S%H834><s%> he hath humbled <S%H6031><s%> her, he may <S%H3201><s%> not <S%H3808><s%> put her away <S%H7971><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> his days. <S%H3117><s%>

A man <S%H376><s%> shall not <S%H3808><s%> take <S%H3947><s%> <S%H853><s%> his father's <S%H1><s%> wife, <S%H802><s%> nor <S%H3808><s%> discover <S%H1540><s%> his father's <S%H1><s%> skirt. <S%H3671><s%>
